intro: Draba ondakensis, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. This species typically grows in rocky, alpine environments where it thrives in well-drained soils. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring, often accompanied by basal leaves that are narrow and linear. Draba ondakensis is adapted to cold climates and is often found in meadows and slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters.
